text: Yan Guang (1â€“75 AD) was an important sage of Yuyao. Yan studied with Emperor Liu Xiu. Liu Xiu offered Yan a high position in the court, but Yan refused, fearing he would become corrupt, and became a hermit in the mountains. As a result, he became a famous Chinese hero and got a place in the Wu Shuang Pu (, Table of Peerless Heroes) by Jin Guliang. == References == Category:1 births Category:75 deaths Category:People from Zhejiang
